“Hey ! Great news!” cried the monitor. “Look, we have received
a letter from the Librarian. And, guess what? We can take story
books home to read.”

“Wow!” exclaimed Shruti with bright round eyes.

“Goodbye, boredom! Welcome happy hours!” shouted Akshay.

The letter from the Librarian was put up on the class notice
board for all to read.

When Mrs Desai walked into the classroom, the students of
Class IV burst out into many exclamations of thanks.

“Shall we write a letter of thanks to the Librarian ?”’suggested

1. You wish to use the Assembly Hall to hold an exhibition of your science projects.
Write a letter to request the Principal to allow you to use the Assembly Hall.

2. Mr and Mrs Prabhune, past students of your school, have given you every kind
of help to hold the exhibition. Write a letter of thanks to them.

You may find the following format useful when you write the letters.

3. Read the following chart carefully :
Sentences
The students of Class IV greeted their teacher. Statement
Come here, Javed and Nisha. Command (or request)

What an opportunity ! Exclamation

And should we end it with, “Yours lovingly’ ? Question

Thus, you can see that there are four kinds of sentences :

* statements * commands (or requests) * exclamations * questions.
Find one example of each kind of sentence from the passages you have
read so far.

4. Note that each kind of sentence can be either positive or negative.

Example : The cuckoo is a lazy bird. (Positive)

The cuckoo is not a lazy bird. (Negative)
